data.scheme_name: MSME Innovative Scheme  - Incubation Component  - Registration as Host Institute (HI)
data.benefits: Scheme provides benefits up to 15 lakhs for developing and nurturing of ideas whereas up to Rs. 1 Cr for Plant and Machinery.
data.eligibility: Institutions such as Technical Colleges, Universities, other Professional Colleges/Institutes, R&D Institutes, NGOs involved in incubation activities, MSME-DIs/ Technology Centers or any Institute/Organization of Central/State Government may apply for registration as an Host Institute (HI) and act as a Business Incubator (BI).
data.conditions:
1. Assistance for Plant and Machinery will be applicable to HIs who’s minimum two or more than two ideas have been approved under the Incubation Scheme. 

2. The financial assistance will be applicable for procurement of Plant and Machinery for development of those specific approved ideas.
data.beneficiaries: Institutions such as Technical Colleges, Universities, other Professional Colleges/Institutes, R&D Institutes, NGOs involved in incubation activities, MSME-DIs/ Technology Centers or any Institute/Organization of Central/State Government may apply for registration as an Host Institute (HI) and act as a Business Incubator (BI) for nurturing of ideas from the initial stage of conceptualization to the commercialization stage through HIs/ BIs.
data.prerequisites:
1. Assistance for Plant and Machinery will be applicable to HIs who’s minimum two or more than two ideas have been approved under the Incubation Scheme. 

2. The financial assistance will be applicable for procurement of Plant and Machinery for development of those specific approved ideas.
data.context: This scheme is introduced to promote a culture of innovation and creative problem solving through knowledge sharing and collaboration amongst industry.
data.objective: The primary objective of the scheme is to promote and support untapped creativity and to promote adoption of latest technologies in MSMEs that seek the validation of their ideas at the proof-of-concept level.
data.description:
A. Financial Assistance to HI for developing and nurturing the ideas: Assistance up to maximum of Rs. 15 lakh per idea shall be provided to HI. Funds will be released after the approval of the idea by PMAC. 

B. Financial assistance for Plant and Machinery to HI: Assistance for Plant and Machinery to HI up to Rs. 1.00 cr. (max) shall be provided for procurement and installation of relevant plant and machines including hardware and software etc. in BI for R&D activities and common facilities for incubatees of BI.
data.how_to_apply: The institutions may apply for registration as HI through the MIS portal of the DC MSME website (https://my.msme.gov.in/inc/HIRegistration.aspx).
data.funding_facilitator: Development Commissioner (DC), Ministry Of Micro, Small And Medium Enterprises
data.funding_mechanism:
The benefit will be passed from: Government of India to Host Institute to Incubatee (MSMEs) 

1. For developing and nurturing ideas - Funds will be released in following two instalments: 

i. 70% of the approved project cost as per below mentioned table, after approval of the idea by PMAC and signing of agreement between Host Institute and Incubatee. 

ii. 30% of the approved project cost after utilization of 60% of 1st instatement utilized and submission of physical verification report by concerned Implementing Agency (IA). 

2. For assistance for Plant and machinery - This financial assistance will be provided upfront and the Utilization Certificate for 50% of the grant be provided within 9 months of the release of the money.
data.additional_info:
• The financial assistance under this component will be available to those who have not availed any Central/State Government subsidy for the same purpose. 
  • The MSME Innovative scheme is designed by integrating three components of CLCSTUS (viz., Incubation, Design & IPR) schemes to create CHAMPIONS, where each component can have interoperability with other components during the phases of intervention to enhance capacities/capabilities of champion MSMEs. 
  • MSME can have opportunity to suitably interlink benefits among three components during the period/stage of implementation. 
  1. There are some options of various combinations like- 
    Only Incubation OR Only Design OR Only IPR 
  2. Incubation-Design-IPR 
  3. Incubation-Design 
  4. Incubation to IPR 
  5. Design-IPR MSME can apply for any one of the above combinations. 
  • The financial assistance will be applicable for availing the benefits as per the individual scheme component. 
  • One scheme may enter from one completed gate to the gate of another scheme as per the requirement of the MSME, while ensuring that the original scheme it enrolled for is taken to the natural conclusion. 
  • At the time of applying for the next scheme, the applicant should adhere to the respective scheme guidelines for that particular scheme.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. University affiliation       
2. Udyam Registration Certificate 
2. AICTE approval letter/Certificate      
3. Other/NABL accreditation       
4. Last 2 years, audited annual accounts with the auditor’s report 
5. Proof of No. of students enrolled during previous two years  
6. Audited financial statements of Business incubators (B.I.)
